{"step_by_step_thinking": "The proportion of false positive results is influenced by the specificity of the test. Specificity is the ability of the test to correctly identify those without the disease (true negative rate). If the specificity is higher, the test is less likely to give a false positive result. Therefore, if the proportion of false positive results is lower in population A, it means the specificity of the test is higher in population A.", "answer_choice": "D"}
